text.name: sys_description
text.text: The PS Vita is a portable console developed by Sony in 2012. It includes two analog sticks, a 5-inch (960Ã—544) capacitive multi-touch OLED touchscreen, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and 3G. It has a 2 Ghz quad-core ARM processor, 512 MB of RAM, 1 Gb of flash memory and a 400 Mhz graphics card. The Vita was initially designed to allow the experience of video games with large budgets on the move. But the public will not follow and its toy library will be especially rich in JRPGs, visual novels and independent games. The PlayStation TV is a non-portable variant of the Vita released in 2014.
